title: Great India BP campaign reaches out to 1,821 people
content:

People getting their blood pressure checked at a kiosk opened by the Pushpagiri Heart Institute in Thiruvalla as part of the Great India BP Campaign on Monday.— Photo: Leju Kamal 

A large number of people, including senior citizens and women, took part in the Great India BP Campaign of the Cardiology Society of India (CSI) in the district on Monday. 

The blood pressure campaign in district was held in association with the Pushpagiri Heart Institute. 

Municipal limits 

According to Fr Rijo Puthenparambil, director of the Information Technology division of the Pushpagiri Medical Society, blood pressure readings of 1,821 persons were recorded as part of the campaign held in Thiruvalla municipal limits from 9 a.m. to 5p.m. Fr Puthenparambil said three BP reading kiosks were opened at the SCS Junction in Thiruvalla town, Thirumoolapuram and at the entrance of the Pushpagiri Medical College.
